nodes.text: Pollus Maksim an individual who served as a Moff in the Galactic Empire. Maksim governed the sector containing the planet Kuat and at some point wrote a foreword in the KDY Corporate Folder, a brochure welcoming investors to Kuat Drive Yards following pro-business reforms by Emperor Palpatine.

In the year 5 ABY, around six months after the Empire's defeat at the Battle of Endor, the nascent New Republic launched an assault on the shipyards and supply bases of Kuat utilized by Kuat Drive Yards, a vital vehicle manufacturer for the Empire. After a weeks-long campaign the guild head of Kuat Drive Yards and Moff Maksim at last conceded, with Maksim offering the Empire's surrender, along with Kuat Drive Yards itself, to Republic Commodore Kyrsta Agate, ending the battle.

Pollus Maksim was first mentioned in the 2016 novel Aftermath: Life Debt, written by Chuck Wendig. On Twitter, Wendig specified that all of the Imperial officers, Maksim included, in his novel were meant to be human.
